thread.title: £3.1m step-free access plans for Godalming station | Meridian
thread.title_full: £3.1m step-free access plans for Godalming station | Meridian - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: £3.1m step-free access plans for Godalming station | Meridian
text:
Artist's impression of bridge Credit: Network Rail Network Rail has announced plans to provide step-free access at Godalming station.
Funded by the government’s Access for All programme, the £3.1m investment plans for the station will include:
Construction of a new fully enclosed footbridge Construction of two 16-person lifts Relocation and replacement of the existing cycle shelters with additional capacity Canopy extensions to provide a weather protected route between the new footbridge structure and existing canopies. Network Rail says it is also investing more than £300k to resurface platforms.
More information is available at a drop-in session at the station from 3-8pm on Wednesday September 9.
Last updated Tue 25 Aug 2015 Travel Surrey Godalming
